text:
The tiger found dead at Wenlock Reserve Forest near Parson Valley in Nilgiris South division was poisoned.

The post-mortem has confirmed that it was a revenge killing and the tiger had consumed meat from the poisoned carcass of a cow. There were also crows numbering nearly 20 lying dead after having consumed meat from the poisoned carcass. Forest Veterinarian E. Vijayaraghavan conducted the post-mortem on Wednesday morning.

Divisional Forest Officer C. Badrasamy said the dead tiger should be aged 10 and the tiger killed now had preyed on some domestic cattle in the recent past. This had resulted in the infuriated habitants of the nearby hamlets poisoning the carcass. Further investigations are on.
title: Big cat, a victim of revenge killing
